group.label: Fastly Configuration
group.comment:
To use this plugin you need a Fastly account ( Create a free account). Once configured, you will need to add a CNAME to your domain.

For setting up TLS/SSL and additional documentation please refer to the full plugin guide.

field.label: Fastly Service ID
field.comment: Learn more about creating a Fastly Service and finding your Service ID.

field.label: Fastly API Token
field.comment:
Please create a Fastly API token with a global scope.

After making any changes to Fastly Service ID or API token, please Save Config first before uploading VCL.

field.label: Automatic Upload & Service Activation
field.comment: Uploads stock Magento VCL. Magento VCL is required in order to take advantage of Fastly full page caching. More details here. Recommended: Re-upload VCL periodically as newer versions of the plugin may contain VCL improvements/fixes.

field.label: Force TLS
field.comment: Return a 301 Moved Permanently redirect to any unencrypted request, and redirect to the TLS equivalent. Also sets HSTS headers.

field.label: Admin path timeout (1-600)
field.comment: Time in seconds for the admin path first byte timeout. Please reupload VCL after making changes.

field.label: Ignored URL Parameters
field.comment: A comma separated list of ignored query string parameters. Please reupload VCL after making changes.

field.label: Stale Content Delivery Time
field.comment: Time in seconds that Fastly will serve stale content while fresh content is being requested. Set to 0 to disable this feature.

field.label: Stale Content Delivery Time in Case of Backend Error
field.comment: Time in seconds that Fastly will continue to serve stale content​ if your origin is unavailable. Set to 0 to disable this feature.

field.label: X-Magento-Tags Size
field.comment: Maximum X-Magento-Tags header size (in bytes).

field.label: Purge Category
field.comment: Choose to purge all the category assets when saving a change to that category.

field.label: Purge Product
field.comment: Choose to purge all the product’s assets when saving a change to that product.

field.label: Purge CMS Page
field.comment: Choose to purge page content when updating or adding a new page in the Magento CMS.

field.label: Preserve Static Assets on Purge
field.comment: When flushing cache, flush only dynamic content and preserve static assets.

field.label: Use Soft Purge
field.comment: Soft Purge​ needs to be turned on in order to serve stale content.

field.label: Enable GeoIP
field.comment: Enable GeoIP for country/language lookup.

field.label: GeoIP Action
field.comment:
"Dialog" shows a modal dialog to select target store.
"Redirect" redirects the client directly to the target store.

field.label: GeoIP Country Mapping
field.comment: Use capitalized two-letter country codes to map countries to store views. Use * to define a default fallback.

field.label: Enable Fastly Edge Modules
field.comment: Enables/Disables Fastly Edge Modules menu.

group.label: Basic Authentication
group.comment: Basic authentication allows you to protect every page and asset on your site with username and password. This can be used to protect the site during development. You will still be able to access Magento admin without basic auth. It is not advised to use this in production.

field.label: Blocking
field.comment: Block traffic from selected ACL IPs and Countries. Please Save Config prior to enabling.

field.label: Update Blocking
field.comment: Applies blocking changes to active setup. HAS TO BE clicked anytime you make blocking changes.

field.label: Blocking Type
field.comment:
Blocklist: block ALL access for users from selected countries/ACLs
Allowlist: block ALL access EXCEPT for users from selected countries/ACLs

field.label: Country List
field.comment: List of countries that can be selected. Multiple selections allowed.

field.label: ACLs
field.comment: List of ACLs that can be selected. Multiple selections allowed.

group.label: Custom Synthetic Pages
group.comment: This option allows you to define synthetic pages. It allows you to paste your own HTML.

field.label: Error/Maintenance Page HTML
field.comment: Configures an error/sorry page that will be sent to all users if Fastly is about to serve an error page (HTTP 500/503) e.g. backend timeouts, backend servers errors etc.

field.label: WAF Page
field.comment: Customize output of the page served to users blocked by the Web Application Firewall (WAF).

group.label: Custom VCL Snippets
group.comment: This option allows you to manage your own custom VCL snippets. You can learn more here. Please note after you have created your snippets you have to click on Upload Fastly VCL to upload them along side stock Fastly VCL.

group.label: Edge ACL
group.comment: Edge ACLs are access control lists that allow you to manage IP addresses that are used in allowing or blocking access to resources. Click here for more details. This interface only allows management of containers and entries. To invoke them you will need to configure your Fastly service.

group.label: Edge Dictionaries
group.comment: Edge Dictionaries are made up of dictionary containers and the dictionary items within them. In combination, containers and items allow you to store data as key-value pairs on Fastly Edge nodes. Click here for more details. This interface only allows management of containers and entries. To invoke them you will need to configure your Fastly service.

field.label: Fastly IO Snippet
field.comment: VCL snippet upload is required in order to funnel image requests to Fastly optimizers.

field.label: Default IO Config Options
field.comment: Allows you to (re)configure items such as default quality levels, lossy image formats, auto WebP, JPG types. These settings will be used as fallbacks when no transformation rules are applied in the URL query string or in your VCL.

field.label: Force Lossy conversion
field.comment: Certain image types are lossless e.g. PNG and BMP and will not compress well. By default Fastly IO will retain original format. This option forces those images to be converted to lossy JPG or WEBP. Applies only to product/catalog images.

field.label: Enable Deep Image Optimization
field.comment: Turns off Magento built-in image resizing and manipulation and offloads it onto Fastly IO. Please read the image optimization guide for caveats and details.

field.label: JPEG Image Quality
field.comment: Sets JPEG image quality, values in percentage from 1 to 100. This value is used in the quality query argument for product/catalog images.

field.label: Set Background Color on Images
field.comment: Adds bg-color query argument for product/catalog images. This will remove a transparency/alpha channel and replace it with the theme background color.

field.label: Set Canvas on Images
field.comment: Adds canvas query argument for product/catalog images.

field.label: Enable Adaptive Device Pixel Ratios
field.comment: Image sources will be rewritten to use srcsets supporting adaptive device pixel ratios. Useful for Progressive Web Apps.

field.label: Device Pixel Ratios
field.comment: Using a higher Device Pixel Ratio means serving larger images.

field.label: Verify Image On Disk
field.comment: Verify image actually exists on the disk. May cause performance issues especially on systems with shared filesystems.

group.label: Maintenance Mode
group.comment: Enabling maintenance mode allows admin IPs (IPs specified in .maintenance.ip file) to access the site as normal while returning an error page to everyone else.

field.label: Update Admin IPs list
field.comment: Updates the list of allowed/admin IPs. The IP values are comma-delimited and read from var/.maintenance.ip file.

field.label: WAF ACL Bypass
field.comment: Allow IPs in selected ACLs to bypass WAF blocking

field.label: Update WAF ACL Bypass
field.comment: Changes WAF ACL bypass. HAS TO BE clicked anytime you make changes to the list of ACLs. Not needed if you are adding/removing IPs. That is done in ACL menu.

field.label: WAF Bypass ACLs
field.comment: Select one or multiple ACLs that are allowed to bypass WAF blocking

group.label: Rate Limiting
group.comment: Experimental: Rate limit specific URL paths against abuse. Please read this guide for more details

field.label: Path Protection Rate Limit
field.comment: Numeric value for the number of tolerated Path Protection Rate Limit requests.

field.label: Path Protection Rate Limit TTL
field.comment: Time in seconds for the Path Protection Rate Limit lifetime.

field.label: Crawler Protection Rate Limit
field.comment: Numeric value for the number of tolerated Crawler Protection Rate Limit requests.

field.label: Crawler Protection Rate Limit TTL
field.comment: Time in seconds for the Crawler Protection Rate Limit lifetime.

field.label: Exempt Known Good Bots
field.comment: Choose to exempt known good bots like Googlebot and Bingbot from Crawler Protection rate limiting

field.label: Export
field.comment: Export Edge ACLs, Edge Dictionaries, Active Edge Modules and Custom Snippets

group.label: Webhook Notifications
group.comment:
Webhooks are a simple way to post messages to external sources. This integration is geared for Slack however you can use it for anything else.
To create Slack Incoming webhooks https://api.slack.com/incoming-webhooks.

field.label: Publish Key and URL Purge Events
Publish Purge All/Clean All Items Events
Publish Stack Trace on All Purge Events
field.comment: Submits the stack trace when any purge event is created, for debugging purposes.

field.label: Publish stack trace on Key and URL Purge Event
field.comment: Submits the stack trace when the purge by key event is created, for debugging purposes.

field.label: Publish stack trace on Purge All/Clean All Event
field.comment: Submits the stack trace when the purge all event is created, for debugging purposes.

group.label: Fastly Edge Modules
group.comment: Fastly Edge module allow you to enable specific functionality like CORS headers, etc. For more details click here.
